query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
1 Al tornar de la mente, che si chiuse 2 dinanzi a la pietà d’i due cognati, 3 che di trestizia tutto mi confuse,
query.error: **English:** 1 When my mind returned, which had been closed 2 before the pity of the two relatives, 3 which had confused me all with sadness,
query.result: 1 Þa min mod gewende, se wæs ær forworden 2 beforan ðære mildheortnesse ðara twega mægða, 3 ðe me eal gehðeorfodon mid heora gedrefednysse,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
4 novi tormenti e novi tormentati 5 mi veggio intorno, come ch’io mi mova 6 e ch’io mi volga, e come che io guati.
query.error: **English:** 4 new torments and new tormented people 5 I see around me, no matter how I move 6 and how I turn, and no matter how I look.
query.result: 4 niwe tintrega and niwe tintregendan 5 ic geseah ymb me, swa hwær swa ic me wende 6 and swa hwær swa ic me cyrnde, and swa hwær swa ic locade.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
7 Io sono al terzo cerchio, de la piova 8 etterna, maladetta, fredda e greve; 9 regola e qualità mai non l’è nova.
query.error: **English:** 7 I am in the third circle, of the rain 8 eternal, cursed, cold, and heavy; 9 rule and quality never change for it.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
10 Grandine grossa, acqua tinta e neve 11 per l’aere tenebroso si riversa; 12 pute la terra che questo riceve.
query.error: **English:** 10 Large hail, dark water, and snow 11 pour down through the darkened air; 12 the earth stinks as it receives this.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
13 Cerbero, fiera crudele e diversa, 14 con tre gole caninamente latra 15 sovra la gente che quivi è sommersa.
query.error: **English:** 13 Cerberus, a cruel and savage beast, 14 with three canine throats barks 15 over the people who are submerged here.
query.result: 13 Cerberus, gryrelicu and grimlicu wiht, 14 ðrimheafdede hellehund, hylð, 15 ofer ða leode ðe ðær licgað forlore.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
16 Li occhi ha vermigli, la barba unta e atra, 17 e ’l ventre largo, e unghiate le mani; 18 graffia li spirti ed iscoia ed isquatra.
query.error: **English:** 16 His eyes are red, his beard greasy and black, 17 and his belly is large, and his hands are clawed; 18 he scratches the spirits and flays and quarters them.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
22 Quando ci scorse Cerbero, il gran vermo, 23 le bocche aperse e mostrocci le sanne; 24 non avea membro che tenesse fermo.
query.error: **English:** 22 When Cerberus, the great worm, saw us, 23 he opened his mouths and showed us his fangs; 24 he had no limb that he could keep still.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
25 E ’l duca mio distese le sue spanne, 26 prese la terra, e con piene le pugna 27 la gittò dentro a le bramose canne.
query.error: **English:** 25 And my leader stretched out his hands, 26 took some earth, and with his fists full 27 threw it into the greedy reeds.
query.result: 25 And min latteow ða his handa breste, 26 feng to ðære eorðan and his fu[s]ta full 27 awearp ða innan ða grapan hreodas.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
28 Qual è quel cane ch’abbaiando agogna, 29 e si racqueta poi che ’l pasto morde, 30 ché solo a divorarlo intende e pugna,
query.error: **English:** 28 Like a dog that barks with longing, 29 and then falls silent when it bites its food, 30 intent only on devouring and fighting,
query.result: 28 Swa is ðæs hundes gecynd ðe gielpende gyrnð, 29 and ðonne he ðæt foddre onfengð, ðonne geswicað he, 30 and ðæs anes freorig is and feohtende,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
31 cotai si fecer quelle facce lorde 32 de lo demonio Cerbero, che ’ntrona 33 l’anime sì, ch’esser vorrebber sorde.
query.error: **English:** 31 so were those filthy faces of 32 the demon Cerberus, who deafens 33 the souls so that they would like to be deaf.
query.result: 31 swa wæron ða wlitegan ansynu 32 ðæs deofles Cerberi, ðe ða sawla swencð, 33 ðæt hi woldon ðæt hi deafe wæron.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
34 Noi passavam su per l’ombre che adona 35 la greve pioggia, e ponavam le piante 36 sovra lor vanità che par persona.
query.error: **English:** 34 We passed over the shades that the heavy 35 rain prostrates, and we set our feet 36 upon their nothingness that seems a person.
query.result: 34 We forðferde ða ofer ða sceаdu ðe ða hefegan 35 regn oferswæðeð, and we setton ure fet 36 ofer heora idelnesse ðe ðuhte ðeah man.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
37 Elle giacean per terra tutte quante, 38 fuor d’una ch’a seder si levò, ratto 39 ch’ella ci vide passarsi davante.
query.error: **English:** 37 They were all lying on the ground, 38 except for one who rose up to sit, quickly 39 when she saw us passing in front of her.
query.result: 37 Hie ðær ealle on ðære eorðan lægen, 38 buton anre ðe ðær upp aras, hraðe 39 ða heo ðær geseah ðurh ða dimman faran.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
40 «O tu che se’ per questo ’nferno tratto», 41 mi disse, «riconoscimi, se sai: 42 tu fosti, prima ch’io disfatto, fatto».
query.error: **English:** 40 "O you who are brought to this hell," 41 he said to me, "recognize me, if you can: 42 you were created before I was undone."
query.result: 40 "Eala ðu ðe eart ðurh ðisne helle broht," 41 cwæð he to me, "gecnawe me, gif ðu miht: 42 ðu wære, ær ic geworht wære, geworht."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
43 E io a lui: «L’angoscia che tu hai 44 forse ti tira fuor de la mia mente, 45 sì che non par ch’i’ ti vedessi mai.
query.error: **English:** 43 And I to him: "The anguish that you have 44 perhaps draws you out of my mind, 45 so that it does not seem that I ever saw you.
query.result: 43 And ic to him: "Þæt angrisce þe þu hafast 44 mæg þe ateon of minre geþohte, 45 swa þæt ne þinceð þæt ic þe æfre gesawe.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
46 Ma dimmi chi tu se’ che ’n sì dolente 47 loco se’ messo, e hai sì fatta pena, 48 che, s’altra è maggio, nulla è sì spiacente».
query.error: **English:** 46 But tell me, who are you who are placed in such a sorrowful 47 place, and have such pain, 48 that if there is another greater, none is so displeasing.
query.result: 46 Ac sege me ðu ðe on ðis dreorighús 47 eardfæst eart and unblide sitst, 48 hwæt ðu sylf sy, ðæt ðu ðus sarig eart.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
49 Ed elli a me: «La tua città, ch’è piena 50 d’invidia sì che già trabocca il sacco, 51 seco mi tenne in la vita serena.
query.error: **English:** 49 And he to me: "Your city, which is so full 50 of envy that the sack is already overflowing, 51 held me with you in the serene life.
query.result: 49 And he to me: "Þin burg ðe is full 50 of inwit ðæt nu ðæt sæd is gesawen, 51 mid ðe ic wæs on ðam siðe gesælig."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
52 Voi cittadini mi chiamaste Ciacco: 53 per la dannosa colpa de la gola, 54 come tu vedi, a la pioggia mi fiacco.
query.error: **English:** 52 You citizens called me Ciacco: 53 for the harmful sin of gluttony, 54 as you see, I am weakened by the rain.
query.result: 52 Ge waron borgware and nemdon me Ciacco: 53 ðurh ða forlorenan synne ðære gitsunge, 54 swa ðu gesihst, on ðære regne ic me hlemme.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
55 E io anima trista non son sola, 56 ché tutte queste a simil pena stanno 57 per simil colpa». E più non fé parola.
query.error: **English:** 55 And I, a sad soul, am not alone, 56 for all these [souls] are in similar pain 57 for a similar fault." And he spoke no more.
query.result: 55 And ic earmra sawl nis na ana, 56 forðæm ðe ealle ðas on ðære ylcan tintre sind 57 ðurh ða ylcan gylt." And he ne spræc na mare.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
58 Io li rispuosi: «Ciacco, il tuo affanno 59 mi pesa sì, ch’a lagrimar mi ’nvita; 60 ma dimmi, se tu sai, a che verranno

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
61 li cittadin de la città partita; 62 s’alcun v’è giusto; e dimmi la cagione 63 per che l’ha tanta discordia assalita».
query.error: **English:** 61 of the citizens of the divided city; 62 if there is any just man among them; and tell me the reason 63 why such great discord has assailed it."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
64 E quelli a me: «Dopo lunga tencione 65 verranno al sangue, e la parte selvaggia 66 caccerà l’altra con molta offensione.
query.error: **English:** 64 And those to me: "After a long contention 65 they will come to blood, and the savage party 66 will chase the other with much harm.
query.result: 64 And ða to me: "Æfter lange geþræce 65 cumað hi to blode, and se wælhreowa dæl 66 awyrpeð oðerne mid micle geswencednysse.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
67 Poi appresso convien che questa caggia 68 infra tre soli, e che l’altra sormonti 69 con la forza di tal che testé piaggia.
query.error: **English:** 67 Then it is necessary that this one fall 68 within three suns, and that the other rise 69 with the power of one who is now descending.
query.result: 67 Þonne bið neod ðæt ðeos niðer asceofe 68 binnan ðrim sunnan, and ðæt oder upweardes 69 ðurh ðæs mihte ðe nu niðer stigeð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
70 Alte terrà lungo tempo le fronti, 71 tenendo l’altra sotto gravi pesi, 72 come che di ciò pianga o che n’aonti.
query.error: **English:** 70 They will keep their foreheads bowed for a long time, 71 bearing the other [foreheads] beneath heavy weights, 72 no matter how much they weep or grieve over it.
query.result: 70 Heora heafda hy længe læne, 71 oðre under ða hefigan byrðene, 72 þeah ðe hi wepen and wæpen.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
73 Giusti son due, e non vi sono intesi; 74 superbia, invidia e avarizia sono 75 le tre faville c’hanno i cuori accesi».
query.error: **English:** 73 Two are just, and they are not understood there; 74 pride, envy, and avarice are 75 the three sparks that have set hearts aflame.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
76 Qui puose fine al lagrimabil suono. 77 E io a lui: «Ancor vo’ che mi ’nsegni 78 e che di più parlar mi facci dono.
query.error: **English:** 76 Here he put an end to the tearful sound. 77 And I to him: "I still want you to teach me 78 and to grant me the gift of more speech.
query.result: 76 Þær he ðone wop forlæt. 77 Ic him ða to cwæð: "Ic ðe furðor bidde, 78 ðæt ðu me ðis spell gerecce."

Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
79 Farinata e ’l Tegghiaio, che fuor sì degni, 80 Iacopo Rusticucci, Arrigo e ’l Mosca 81 e li altri ch’a ben far puoser li ’ngegni,

Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
82 dimmi ove sono e fa ch’io li conosca; 83 ché gran disio mi stringe di savere 84 se ’l ciel li addolcia o lo ’nferno li attosca».
query.error: **English:** 82 tell me where they are and let me know them; 83 for a great desire constrains me to know 84 if Heaven sweetens them or Hell embitters them.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
85 E quelli: «Ei son tra l’anime più nere; 86 diverse colpe giù li grava al fondo: 87 se tanto scendi, là i potrai vedere.
query.error: **English:** 85 And he: "They are not among the blackest souls; 86 different sins weigh them down to the bottom: 87 if you descend so far, you will be able to see them there.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
88 Ma quando tu sarai nel dolce mondo, 89 priegoti ch’a la mente altrui mi rechi: 90 più non ti dico e più non ti rispondo».
query.error: **English:** 88 But when you will be in the sweet world, 89 I pray you that you bring me to the minds of others: 90 I say no more to you and answer you no more."
query.result: 88 Ac ðonne ðu on ðæm wynsumum weorolde sy, 89 bidde ic ðe ðæt ðu ðone mod oðerra monna me gemyne: 90 ne ic ðe mare secge ne ðe mare andwyrde."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
91 Li diritti occhi torse allora in biechi; 92 guardommi un poco e poi chinò la testa: 93 cadde con essa a par de li altri ciechi.
query.error: **English:** 91 Then he twisted his righteous eyes askance; 92 he looked at me a little and then bowed his head: 93 with it he fell beside the other blind men.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
94 E ’l duca disse a me: «Più non si desta 95 di qua dal suon de l’angelica tromba, 96 quando verrà la nimica podesta:
query.error: **English:** 94 And the leader said to me: "No one awakens 95 from this side of the sound of the angelic trumpet, 96 when the enemy's power will come:
query.result: 94 And ða heretoga cwæð to me: "Ne bið her na mare 95 of ðissum stede ðurh ðære engles byman, 96 ðonne ðæs feondes mægen cymeð:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
97 ciascun rivederà la trista tomba, 98 ripiglierà sua carne e sua figura, 99 udirà quel ch’in etterno rimbomba».
query.error: **English:** 97 each one will see again the sad tomb, 98 will take back his flesh and his form, 99 will hear that which resounds eternally."
query.result: 97 ælc mon sceal eft geseon ða sarigean byrgene, 98 and eft onfôn his flæsc and his hiw, 99 and gehyran ðæt ðe on ecnysse ðunað."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
100 Sì trapassammo per sozza mistura 101 de l’ombre e de la pioggia, a passi lenti, 102 toccando un poco la vita futura;
query.error: **English:** 100 Thus we passed through a foul mixture 101 of shadows and of rain, with slow steps, 102 touching a little on the future life;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
103 per ch’io dissi: «Maestro, esti tormenti 104 crescerann’ ei dopo la gran sentenza, 105 o fier minori, o saran sì cocenti?».
query.error: **English:** 103 wherefore I said: "Master, will these torments 104 grow greater after the great judgment, 105 or will they be less, or will they be as fierce?".
query.result: 103 forðæm ic ða cwæð: "Lareow, ðas wite 104 weorðað ðe mare æfter ðam miclan dome, 105 oððe ðe læsse, oððe ðe swilce?".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
106 Ed elli a me: «Ritorna a tua scïenza, 107 che vuol, quanto la cosa è più perfetta, 108 più senta il bene, e così la doglienza.
query.error: **English:** 106 And he said to me: "Return to your knowledge, 107 which wills that, the more perfect a thing is, 108 the more it feels pleasure, and thus pain.
query.result: 106 And he sæde to me: "Bewend ðu to ðinum geþeahte, 107 ðe wile ðæt ðe ðing sie swiðor fulfremed, 108 ðe ma hit ðæs gōdan and ðæs yflan gefæle."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
109 Tutto che questa gente maladetta 110 in vera perfezion già mai non vada, 111 di là più che di qua essere aspetta».
query.error: **English:** 109 All of these wretched people 110 never attain true perfection, 111 and they expect to be worse off there than here.
query.result: 109 Ealle ða wreccea gastas 110 næfre to rihtre æfæstnesse ne cumao, 111 ðær wyrs ðonne her wæned to habbanne.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
112 Noi aggirammo a tondo quella strada, 113 parlando più assai ch’i’ non ridico; 114 venimmo al punto dove si digrada:
query.error: **English:** 112 We circled around that road, 113 speaking much more than I recount; 114 we came to the point where it descends:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
115 quivi trovammo Pluto, il gran nemico.
query.error: **English:** 115 there we found Pluto, the great enemy.
query.result: 115 ðær fundon we ðone feond Plutonem.
